data.title: University of Vermont: Ranking, Fees, Eligibility, Admissions
data.meta_description: Get details on University of Vermont including, offered courses, eligibility, ranking, fees, scholarship, admission process, etc. Apply for University of now.
data.text:
About us

The University of Vermont (UVM), officially known as The University of Vermont and State Agricultural College, is a public-funded research university located in Burlington, Vermont. It was established in 1791 and is deemed as one of the United States' oldest universities. The campus of UVM sprawls across 450 acres of land and has an urban setting. The university operates out of academic schools: the College of Business Studies, College of Engineering & Mathematical Sciences, College of Arts & Sciences, College of Agriculture & Life Sciences, College of Medicine, College of Social Sciences, Honors College, College of Nursing & Health Sciences and College of Environment & Natural Resources. It offers more than 100 bachelor degree programs, 35 master's programs, 26 doctoral degree programs; it also includes an M.D. program and four pre-professional options like- pre-medical, pre-dental, pre-vat, pre-law. Thus, UVM has an exceptional range of study abroad programs for international students. The current enrollment of UVM is 11000 plus students. The University of Vermont is a proud Alma Mater of numerous notable alumni, including Duane Graveline, Amr Kashmiri, and James O'Halloran.
